snippet: A State Senate candidate in Massachusetts is one of President Obama’s few former aides who is running for office; far more have joined the ranks of high-paid consultants.
abstract: Pres Obama, who came to office tapping into spirit of volunteerism and deep connection with young people, has so far failed to inspire many of them to become involved in electoral politics; only handful of Obama's former aides and staffers have run for office, with far more joining ranks of high-paid consultants; Eric Lesser, candidate for State Senate in Massachusetts, is one of the few who have chosen political path.
lead_paragraph: A State Senate candidate in Massachusetts is one of President Obama’s few former aides who is running for office; far more have joined the ranks of high-paid consultants.

headline.main: Obama Effect Inspiring Few to Seek Office
headline.print_headline: Obama Effect Inspiring Few to Seek Office
